meanings.definition: To classify or categorize as a subclass.
meanings.sent1: She subclassed the animals into mammals and reptiles.
meanings.sent2: The teacher subclassed the students based on their reading levels.
meanings.sent3: The chef subclassed the ingredients into spicy and mild before cooking.
meanings.sent4: The detective subclassed the suspects into potential culprits and innocent bystanders.
meanings.sent5: The librarian subclassed the books by genre for easy access.

meanings.sent1: He subclassed the new employees to the training program.
meanings.sent2: The manager subclassed the tasks to different departments.
meanings.sent3: The designer subclassed the colors into warm and cool tones for the palette.
meanings.sent4: The scientist subclassed the samples into control and experimental groups.
meanings.sent5: The coach subclassed the players into offense and defense teams.
